stimulusHtml: Researchers are interested in whether a nutritionally poor diet during pregnancy increases the likelihood of birth defects. Which of the following most accurately explains why a correlational research design is the best option for investigating this question?
choicesHtml: A correlational study allows researchers to draw conclusions about cause and effect.
A correlational study permits researchers to have precise control over variables.
Because of ethical concerns, participants could not be randomly assigned to groups.
It would be relatively easy to collect data from large samples of pregnant women.
